title: Mattala airport operation to open up for private investments
byline: Despite its previous stand regarding privatization of state assets, the government, led by the National People’s Power (NPP), is seeking to call for Expression of Interest (EoI) to open up the Mattala International Airport (MIA) for private investors for operation of its services in different categories, an official said.

title: Water levels in power generating reservoirs low albeit weather causing havoc
byline: Despite the prevailing inclement weather having caused much havoc disrupting civilian life and the breakdown of utility services including electricity, the engineers in charge of the hydropower generating reservoirs said the rain fall experienced in the catchment areas was not adequate to raise the water level in Castlereigh and Maussakele reservoirs.

title: 25 yr. old suspect nabbed with Rs. 70 million worth heroin in Veyangoda
byline: A stock of 3.650 kilos of heroin was seized and the suspect was arrested by Veyangoda police during a raid on the suspect’s house at Niwala area on Saturday evening.

title: Bangladesh drops Sheikh Mujib’s portrait from currency notes
byline: Bangladesh has started issuing newly designed banknotes that do not feature the portrait of the country’s founder and former prime minister Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.

title: 53 year old man arrested for raping 14 year old girl in Haputale
byline: An individual who raped and impregnated a 14 year old schoolgirl was taken into custody yesterday by Haputale police. The 53 year old suspect is a father of three children.

title: Two dead and hundreds arrested in France after PSG Champions League win
byline: Two people have died and hundreds have been arrested across France after Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) fans celebrated the club’s victory in the Champions League final, according to the French interior ministry.

title: Sri Lankan tourist attacked in Pattaya after gender dispute with transwoman
byline: A Sri Lankan tourist was assaulted by a transgender woman armed with high heel shoes on the city’s beach road Saturday night after he daringly touched her genitals twice to verify her gender--then refused to pay or proceed with any services.

title: Delay in bringing those responsible for Easter Sunday attacks regrettable: Catholic church in Sri Lanka
byline: While expressing satisfaction on the investigations carried out into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks, the National Catholic Church Communications Director Fr. Jude Krishantha today said the church is not happy about the delay in bringing those responsible to justice.

title: ’’She simply stepped into her own”: Ali Sabry defends Anudhi
byline: Former Minister Ali Sabry came to the defense of Miss World Sri Lanka representative Anudhi Gunasekara, calling for dignity and support amid a wave of online criticism.

title: Over 50% of power outages restored amid severe weather: CEB
byline: In the wake of torrential rains and gale-force winds that battered the country, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that nearly half of the widespread power outages reported during the extreme weather have been restored.

title: Government planning to export locally produced brown sugar: Handunnetti
byline: The government is planning to export locally produced brown sugar as a move to raise the revenue of local sugar factories and thereby to protect the employees and sugar planters, Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi said today.

title: CEB trade unionist appointed Mayor of Kaduwela
byline: Ranjan Jayalal, a prominent trade unionist affiliated with the JVP-led trade union in the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), has been appointed as the new Mayor of Kaduwela.

title: Govt to take immediate action to change policy on returning refugees -Minister
byline: The government has announced plans to swiftly revise existing legal policies following the detention of a UNHCR-certified returning refugee from India, who was held by Immigration officials at Palaly Airport and later remanded by the Mallakam Magistrate’s Court until June 5th.

title: Monitoring increases as new COVID sub-variants detected
byline: Health authorities in Sri Lanka have ramped up monitoring efforts following the detection of two new Omicron subvariants - LF.7 and XFG - within the country.

title: Failed shooting attempt reported in Panadura
byline: A failed shooting attempt was reported in Walana, Panadura, this morning, police said.

title: Polish conservative Nawrocki leads presidential vote
byline: Eurosceptic Karol Nawrocki established a lead in Sunday’s presidential election in Poland, late exit polls showed, with the ballot seen as a test of the nation’s support for a pro-European course versus Donald Trump-style nationalism.

title: Ukraine destroyed more than 40 military aircraft in a drone attack deep inside Russia, official say
byline: A Ukrainian drone attack destroyed more than 40 Russian planes deep in Russia’s territory, a Ukrainian security official told The Associated Press on Sunday, while Russia pounded Ukraine with missiles and drones a day before the two sides meet for a new round of direct talks in Istanbul.

title: External sector stays resilient in April despite import surge
byline: Sri Lanka’s external sector showed steady footing in April 2025, holding its ground amid mounting import pressure, as the country posted a current account surplus for the fourth consecutive month, thanks to strong inflows from tourism and worker remittances.

title: Sri Lanka prepares to host more international films
byline: Sri Lanka is positioning itself to capitalise on the growing global demand for film tourism, but infrastructure and technology must be upgraded to compete internationally, Assistant Director, International Media at the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB), Chaminda Munasinghe said.

title: Bangladesh drops Sheikh Mujib’s portrait from currency notes
byline: Bangladesh has started issuing newly designed banknotes that do not feature the portrait of the country’s founder and former prime minister Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.

title: Two dead and hundreds arrested in France after PSG Champions League win
byline: Two people have died and hundreds have been arrested across France after Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) fans celebrated the club’s victory in the Champions League final, according to the French interior ministry.

title: Court halts Kekirawa Peradeniya Sabha women’s seat nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order restraining the Returning Officer of the Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha from implementing his letter requesting the nomination of women members for the seats obtained by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) under the proportional representation system at the Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha election.

title: CID releases AI-generated images of wanted suspects
byline: The Homicide and Organised Crime Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has released facial images of suspects linked to a serious crime in the Southern Province and is seeking public assistance to arrest them.

title: Finance Secretary Mahinda Siriwardana to retire
byline: Mahinda Siriwardana, the current Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, will retire from his post at the end of this month, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced today.

title: Australian Deputy Prime Minister to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Australian Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence Richard Marles will arrive in Sri Lanka on an official visit on Tuesday, June 2, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced.

title: Glenn Maxwell retires from ODI cricket
byline: Glenn Maxwell, the architect of arguably the greatest ODI innings ever played, has announced his retirement from the 50-over international format effective immediately but he will remain available for T20 internationals and looks set to continue until next year’s T20 World Cup.

title: President urges to pay taxes, pledges legal action on tax abuse
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today urged all citizens to fulfil their tax obligations, assuring that tax revenue will be fully protected and that legal action will be taken against anyone who misuses public funds.

title: Regulating media must be confined to preventing personal insults: Opposition MP
byline: Commenting on the Government’s move to regulate social media, Lpposition MP S.M. Marikar said today that regulating any form of media should be confined only to preventing personal insults.

title: Mumbai’s ‘choo-choo’ rail engines head to Sri Lanka
byline: Five diesel locos from the city to roar on Sri Lankan tracks as India sends 22 power-packed engines across the sea; these WDM3A Alco-class locomotives have been workhorses, powering top-tier trains across Indian Railways, especially on the Konkan Railway before electrification.

title: BASL calls for urgent appointment of RTI Commission head
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has formally raised concerns over the ongoing vacancy of the position of Chairperson of the Right to Information (RTI) Commission, emphasising the critical nature of this role for the functioning of the Commission and the upholding of citizens’ rights.

title: Delay in bringing those responsible for Easter Sunday attacks to justice is regrettable: Catholic church in Sri Lanka
byline: While expressing satisfaction on the investigations carried out into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks, the National Catholic Church Communications Director Fr. Jude Krishantha today said the church is not happy about the delay in bringing those responsible to justice.

title: Chikungunya infected MP calls for action
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Dr. Kavinda Jayawardene, who is infected with Chikungunya, called upon all parties for quick and effective action while shedding politics aside to halt the spread of the disease.

title: President files tax returns, reduces his own expenses
byline: Marking the launch of the Inland Revenue Department’s new online tax platform, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake became the first individual to file tax returns for the 2024–2025 assessment year.

title: Former Urban Council Chairman arrested over Rs. 2.38 Mn loss
byline: Former Chairman of the Lindula-Talawakelle Urban Council, Asoka Sepala, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Sri Lanka to launch Starlink Internet Services pending final approval
byline: Sri Lanka is on the verge of launching satellite internet services through Starlink, with all necessary government processes now complete, according to the Ministry of Digital Economy.

title: Court halts Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha women’s seat nominations
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order restraining the Returning Officer of the Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha from implementing his letter requesting the nomination of women members for the seats obtained by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) under the proportional representation system at the Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha election.
